abstract: Apple has shielded billions in cash from federal  taxes in overseas accounts, drawing Senate scrutiny.
snippet: Apple has shielded billions in cash from federal  taxes in overseas accounts, drawing Senate scrutiny.
lead_paragraph: Members of the United States Senate are expected to sharply criticize Apple’s global tax tactics while questioning the company’s chief executive, Timothy D. Cook, at a Congressional hearing on Tuesday.

headline.main: Senate Panel Is Expected to Castigate Apple on Tax Tactics

byline.original: By Charles Duhigg and David Kocieniewski

abstract: A Congressional inquiry’s findings were remarkable both for the tens of billions of dollars involved and for Apple’s audacity in saying some of its subsidiaries were stateless and beyond any tax authority’s reach.
snippet: A Congressional inquiry’s findings were remarkable both for the tens of billions of dollars involved and for Apple’s audacity in saying some of its subsidiaries were stateless and beyond any tax authority’s reach.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Even as Apple became the nation’s most profitable technology company, it avoided billions in taxes in the United States and around the world through a web of subsidiaries so complex it spanned continents and went beyond anything most experts had ever seen, Congressional investigators disclosed on Monday.

headline.main: Apple’s Web of Tax Shelters Saved It Billions, Panel Finds
headline.print_headline: Billions In Taxes Avoided By Apple, U.S. Inquiry Finds

byline.original: By Nelson D. Schwartz and Charles Duhigg
